result.execSummary:
The defendant Sackpraseuth Bounsinh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers. Defendant shall be tested at least once per month, randomly. 
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sackpraseuth Bounsinh in court with attorney Mark E Kershek.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Megan Williamson.
Sworn as interpreter:  Pom Ozolins

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  Court gives credit for 4 days served. 
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- Serve 30 DAYS UP FRONT CONDITION TIME CONSECUTIVE, in the House of Correction - with huber for work, and meeting with agent.  Court will allow defendant to be released to work 10 hour shifts.

                         REPORT IN DATE:  TUESDAY, JUNE 3, 2014 BY 9 AM.

If defendant fails to report, defendant shall serve sentence STRAIGHT TIME, ALL COMMUNITY ACCESS IS CANCELLED.

- 90 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 60 days for the third violation.  Court will allow huber for work.
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- No controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested at least once per month, randomly.  
- Maintain full time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Sentencing Referral Form;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Defendant Sackpraseuth Bounsinh in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Megan Williamson.  Sworn as interpreter:  Zongcheng Moua.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 5/30/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sackpraseuth Bounsinh in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Zongcheng Moua.
State will provide defense with a offer.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/1/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sackpraseuth Bounsinh in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Paul Hauer for Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter: Zongcheng Moua.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark E Kershek in court.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Step Nolten for Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense Counsel is requesting a Laotian Interpreter for the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sackpraseuth Bounsinh in court.  Paul Hauer for Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant informs the Court that he is in the process of obtaining private counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Status of Counsel in Branch PE. Court informs the defendant that at the next scheduled court appearance, the defendant is expected to appear with an attorney.  Status conference scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Sackpraseuth Bounsinh in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Defendant Sackpraseuth Bounsinh in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
